solution_line_template: If Adelaide bought {adelaide_ducks} ducks, Ephraim bought {adelaide_ducks} ducks / {adelaide_ephraim_ratio} = <<{adelaide_ducks}/{adelaide_ephraim_ratio}={ephraim_ducks}>>{ephraim_ducks} ducks.

Since Ephraim bought {ephraim_kolton_difference} fewer ducks than Kolton, Kolton bought {ephraim_kolton_difference} ducks + {ephraim_ducks} ducks = <<{ephraim_kolton_difference}+{ephraim_ducks}={kolton_ducks}>>{kolton_ducks} ducks

The total number of ducks the three bought is {kolton_ducks} ducks + {ephraim_ducks} ducks + {adelaide_ducks} ducks = <<{kolton_ducks}+{ephraim_ducks}+{adelaide_ducks}={total_ducks}>>{total_ducks} ducks
The average number of ducks each bought is {total_ducks} ducks / {number_of_people} people = <<{total_ducks}/{number_of_people}={average_ducks}>>{average_ducks} ducks/person
